commitResults.messageTitle: Renamed Duke.java to Lindi.java, implemented simple greet and exit
Refactored good bye message to a function call goodByeAndExit(), which also terminates the program. Removed junk comments
Refactored greeting messages into a function call greeting().
Added chatLoop that echoes what the user types, and exists when user types 'bye'
Created function parseInputAndExecute and condensed all such parsing userInput functionality into that. Added add, list capabilities for tasks
Improved UI by improving feedback when task added
Created Task.java class and modified Lindi.java to handle the changed representation of tasks as Task not String
Added function to mark tasks as done and undone
Created classes Deadline, Event and ToDo
Removed complicated logic check for mark and unmark. Will handle them in future with error handling
Made Task abstract and factory method for the 3 subclasses
Added supported for tracking ToDos, Deadlines and Events
Improved text UI response
Tested using I/O redirection for automated testing. Changed method to receive input to use the Scanner object, as it can take in file input as well
Create Exception classes related to creation of tasks
Added error handling related to creation of tasks, as well as parsing user input
added more text feedback (when list on empty taskList), and updated automated text UI texting to reflect more cases
Changed implementation of taskList to ArrayList<Task> instead of static Task[] array
Added support for deleting tasks from the list
Fixed long standing bug for mark, unmark and delete crashing when not receiving proper arguments. Now handles the error.
Compiled functionality of mark, unmark and delete into singular function executeModifyTask. Removed redundant functions
Create primitive saveToFile() function
commitResults.messageBody:
saveToFile() simply saves to a file in ./.data/LindiData.txt, creating
the /.data directory and txt file if not exists yet.
Currently writes a bogus message.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add parsedFormatToSave() method to Task and its subclasses
Update saveToFile() to actually save taskList information
Add createFromParsedString() method to Task
commitResults.messageBody:
This takes in as input the parsedString that we save in the data file
and calls the Task.create() constructor. Basically we are enabling
our Task class to be loaded from the save file

commitResults.messageTitle: Add save and load feature to Lindi
commitResults.messageBody:
Lindi does not permanently store changes to the taskList, as it
is stored in a temporary array.

A new session would effectively wipe the users taskList. This is
not conducive for a user who wants to use the app for real life
task tracking.

Let's
* implement loading our current taskList when we start the session
* saving our taskList automatically whenever we make a change

We save it as a text in a txt file in a hidden folder in our current
directory '/.data/'. We save it as text for now because of ease of
implementation as well as it is human readable, which makes it easier
to debug.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-Level-7'
commitResults.messageBody: This branch adds the save and load feature
